I added the templates as described in
https://bugs.eclipse.org/bugs/show_bug.cgi?id=41118#c5

When selecting a word and invoking ctrl-space and selecting the "comment word"
template a small "empty" message box opens containing an "OK" button, the error
icon (red circle with white cross) and  a headline "Template..." only.

There are no entries in the error log.
I cannot reproduce this problem on Eclipse 3.2 dev stream.

A screen shot of the message box may help in the dianosis as well. Thanks.

Created an attachment (id=27722)
Error popup screenshot

Create templates for Ant and AntTask categories in Ant Editor as in previous
comment.

Open any Ant editor. Select some word or line (e.g. property within project,
some properties or tasks within target), push Ctrl-Space to activate completion
and choose one of these templates. This error popup dialog appear.

I don't think there should be any dialogs like this in first place. Because any
modal popups are really distracting.

(In reply to comment #3)
> Exact steps to reproduce as I must be missing something.
> A screen shot of the message box may help in the dianosis as well. Thanks.
I get the same message box as Eugene but I don't get any entries in the .log
file (well, there is no .log file in .metadata).

I'm using Eclipse 3.2M2 on Windows 2000 with JDK 5 (build 1.5.0_04-b05)

Here are my templates:

<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?><templates><template autoinsert="true"
context="org.eclipse.ant.ui.templateContextType.task" deleted="false"
description="" enabled="true" name="comment line"><!-- 
${line_selection} 
--></template><template autoinsert="true"
context="org.eclipse.ant.ui.templateContextType.task" deleted="false"
description="" enabled="true" name="comment word"><!-- ${word_selection}
-->
</template></templates>

Steps to reproduce:
1. Create a new workspace
2. Import above templates to ant templates
3. Create java project
4. Create build.xml file
5. Open with Ant Editor
6. <Ctrl><Space> and select "Buildfile template"
7. Select line with "</description>" (line 13 in template)
8. <Ctrl><Space> and select "Comment line -"
9. Dialog Box as attached appears.
10. Press "Ok"
11. Nothing happens to build file

Thank you for the exact steps...if only all bug reports contained steps like 
these :-)

Able to reproduce.

CC Tom for the similarities to bug 126662.

Tom can you help out by detailing what was fixed in the Java space to help me more quickly narrow down what needs to be fixed here...or if it is a general bug in the template framework for non Java template completions

(In reply to comment #8)
> CC Tom for the similarities to bug 126662.
> 
> Tom can you help out by detailing what was fixed in the Java space to help me
> more quickly narrow down what needs to be fixed here...or if it is a general
> bug in the template framework for non Java template completions

The fix was Java(doc) only, and the fix was to use the Position based constructor of DocumentTemplateContext in order to track the active area where the template is being expanded.

The trace in comment 4 seems not related to templates however and I doubt it triggered that "error dialog".

I could reproduce the error, and I believe it is due to a bug in AntContext::getEnd. The method currently returns the length of the active area, but it should return its end offset. The following patch fixed that particular problem in my workspace (beware of line breaks):

Index: Ant Editor/org/eclipse/ant/internal/ui/editor/templates/AntContext.java
===================================================================
RCS file: /cvsroot/eclipse/org.eclipse.ant.ui/Ant Editor/org/eclipse/ant/internal/ui/editor/templates/AntContext.java,v
retrieving revision 1.11
diff -u -r1.11 AntContext.java
--- Ant Editor/org/eclipse/ant/internal/ui/editor/templates/AntContext.java	23 Feb 2005 17:31:02 -0000	1.11
+++ Ant Editor/org/eclipse/ant/internal/ui/editor/templates/AntContext.java	8 Feb 2006 08:48:55 -0000
@@ -67,7 +67,7 @@
 		if (replacementOffset > 0 && getDocument().get().charAt(replacementOffset - 1) == '<') {
 			replacementLength++;
 		}
-		return replacementLength;
+		return replacementOffset + replacementLength;
 	}
 	
 	/* (non-Javadoc)

Thanks for the help Tom.
This pointed me in the right direction.

There was the bug you found and then we also needed to consider selection when setting up the context.

Fixed in AntContext and AntEditorCompletionProcessor.
I also added the comment templates as defaults so there are changes to ant.properties and ant.xml in the templates folder.
